intro: Pilosella chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean pearly everlet, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are surrounded by a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, pearly appearance. Pilosella chilensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
